newCreatures.description: 15 new SCADAmon creatures representing advanced ICS security concepts. Designed to complement the base creature roster with more specialized and powerful options.

creatures.name: Purgamon
creatures.description: A towering guardian formed of crystallized network segments, each layer glowing with different intensity. Purgamon embodies the Purdue Model, with its body organized into distinct zones that attackers must traverse one by one. Its core contains the most sensitive control processes.

abilities.name: Zone Defense
abilities.description: Creates layered barriers that reduce damage based on how many network layers the opponent has successfully penetrated
abilities.effect: Reduces incoming damage by 15% per defensive layer (max 60%)

abilities.name: IDMZ Intercept
abilities.description: Intercepts attacks passing between network zones, reflecting a portion back
abilities.effect: 25% chance to reflect 50% of attack damage back to attacker

creatures.flavorText: Ancient security architects claim Purgamon inspired the Purdue Model itself, appearing in visions to early ICS designers as the perfect form of layered protection.

creatures.name: Segmantis
creatures.description: A mantis-like creature with crystalline exoskeleton divided into perfectly isolated segments. Each body section operates independently—damage to one segment never affects another. Its scythe-arms can slice through even the most hardened network connections.

abilities.name: Network Isolation
abilities.description: Completely isolates a target from network effects for one turn
abilities.effect: Target cannot receive buffs, debuffs, or damage from non-direct attacks

abilities.name: Lateral Movement Block
abilities.description: Creates barriers that prevent attackers from moving between zones
abilities.effect: Prevents opponent's combo attacks; each attack must target from scratch

abilities.name: Conduit Control
abilities.description: Controls all communication paths, only allowing sanctioned traffic
abilities.effect: Negates 30% of opponent's special attacks; counters with precision strike

creatures.flavorText: Where Purgamon defines the zones, Segmantis enforces them. In well-defended facilities, operators claim to see its shimmering form standing guard at every network boundary.

creatures.name: Modbyte
creatures.description: A small, simple creature that communicates in pure binary. Modbyte is direct and unsophisticated—what you see is what you get. It has no natural defenses but is surprisingly effective when placed in the right environment.

abilities.name: Function Code
abilities.description: Executes a specific command type based on battle conditions
abilities.effect: Read (FC03): Reveals opponent stats. Write (FC06): Applies precise damage. Diagnostic (FC08): Self-heal 15HP

abilities.name: Register Access
abilities.description: Directly accesses and modifies target's internal values
abilities.effect: 50% chance to reduce one of opponent's stats by 10%

evolutionInfo.evolutionCondition: Win 10 battles using only Protocol-type moves

creatures.flavorText: Engineers affectionately call Modbyte 'reliable but vulnerable'—it does exactly what you tell it, trusting anyone who sends a command. Handle with care on untrusted networks.

creatures.name: Protocrawl
creatures.description: A serpentine creature that has evolved to understand multiple industrial languages. Its body displays symbols from every major protocol standard. Protocrawl can translate between protocol dialects and identify weaknesses in communication.

abilities.name: Protocol Polyglot
abilities.description: Adapts attacks to bypass opponent's protocol-based defenses
abilities.effect: Attacks ignore 40% of defense when target uses protocol-type abilities

abilities.name: Deep Packet Inspection
abilities.description: Analyzes all incoming attacks for malicious content
abilities.effect: 30% chance to completely negate incoming special attacks

abilities.name: Session Hijack
abilities.description: Takes control of an ongoing attack sequence
abilities.effect: Can redirect opponent's multi-turn attack to different target

creatures.flavorText: Legend says Protocrawl was born when a network analyzer gained sentience, absorbing the essence of every packet that passed through it over a thousand years.

creatures.name: Hashling
creatures.description: A small spherical creature that constantly verifies its own existence. Hashling's surface displays rolling cryptographic symbols that change with every observation. It can instantly detect when anything about itself—or its surroundings—has been modified.

abilities.name: Integrity Check
abilities.description: Verifies that neither self nor allies have been tampered with
abilities.effect: Removes all debuffs from self and adjacent allies; reveals hidden status effects

abilities.name: Change Detection
abilities.description: Immediately alerts when any modification occurs
abilities.effect: Automatically counters the first stat-modification attack each turn

creatures.flavorText: Hashlings are born in pairs—one maintains the hash of the other, and vice versa. Separating them causes both to become deeply suspicious of everything.

creatures.name: Cryptoguard
creatures.description: An armored warrior whose shield constantly displays rotating cryptographic keys. Cryptoguard protects the authenticity and integrity of everything within its domain. Attackers find that nothing they do has lasting effect—Cryptoguard simply restores the verified state.

abilities.name: Credential Guard
abilities.description: Isolates critical credentials in a protected vault
abilities.effect: Prevents credential-stealing attacks; immune to impersonation

abilities.name: Signed Execution
abilities.description: Only allows verified actions to take effect
abilities.effect: 25% chance that any attack against Cryptoguard simply fails verification

abilities.name: Rollback
abilities.description: Restores previous known-good state
abilities.effect: Once per battle, restore HP and stats to values from 3 turns ago

creatures.flavorText: Security researchers theorize that Cryptoguard doesn't actually exist in our timeline—it exists in a cryptographically verified parallel dimension and merely projects its presence here.

creatures.name: Auditrix
creatures.description: A creature with countless eyes arranged in concentric rings, each eye recording everything it sees. Auditrix never forgets and can replay any event it has witnessed with perfect accuracy. Its presence alone deters many attackers.

abilities.name: Continuous Logging
abilities.description: Records all actions taken by all participants
abilities.effect: Creates a battle log that reveals hidden information and cannot be deleted

abilities.name: Alert Generation
abilities.description: Immediately notifies of suspicious activity
abilities.effect: When opponent uses a debuff or status effect, Auditrix gets a free counter-attack

creatures.flavorText: They say nothing escapes Auditrix's notice. Clever attackers have learned to generate so many false events that the real attack is lost in the noise—this annoys Auditrix greatly.

creatures.name: Sentinull
creatures.description: A towering sentinel whose body is composed of flowing log streams and alert patterns. Sentinull doesn't just observe—it correlates, analyzes, and acts. Where Auditrix records, Sentinull comprehends the meaning behind the events.

abilities.name: SIEM Correlation
abilities.description: Combines multiple weak signals into powerful insight
abilities.effect: Stacking effect: Each turn observing increases next attack damage by 15% (max 60%)

abilities.name: Threat Hunt
abilities.description: Proactively searches for hidden dangers
abilities.effect: Reveals all hidden status effects, incoming attacks, and opponent's next planned action

abilities.name: Automated Response
abilities.description: Triggers pre-planned defensive actions when threats are detected
abilities.effect: When HP drops below 30%, automatically applies defense buff and heals 20HP

creatures.flavorText: Sentinull processes millions of events per second, finding the single needle of real threat hidden in haystacks of normal activity. It never sleeps, and it never misses.

creatures.name: Complion
creatures.description: A creature made of scrolls, policy documents, and regulatory frameworks, all woven together into a coherent form. Complion ensures that all actions follow proper procedure and can cite chapter and verse for any security requirement.

abilities.name: Policy Enforcement
abilities.description: Ensures all actions comply with established rules
abilities.effect: Opponent's attacks that violate 'documented rules' (status effects, debuffs) have 30% reduced effectiveness

abilities.name: Audit Trail
abilities.description: Maintains perfect records for compliance verification
abilities.effect: Creates documentation that prevents opponent from denying actions taken

evolutionInfo.evolutionCondition: Complete 15 battles without using any 'non-compliant' moves

creatures.flavorText: Complion is often dismissed as bureaucratic and slow, but those who face it in battle find that when every action is documented, every weakness is eventually found.

creatures.name: Riskmaster
creatures.description: An evolved form that has transcended mere compliance to truly understand risk. Riskmaster can assess any threat's likelihood and impact, prioritizing responses for maximum effectiveness. Its form constantly shifts as it recalculates risk profiles.

abilities.name: Risk Assessment
abilities.description: Analyzes threat landscape to optimize defense
abilities.effect: At start of battle, identifies opponent's highest-damage attack and gains 50% resistance to it

abilities.name: Crown Jewel Protection
abilities.description: Identifies and protects the most critical assets
abilities.effect: Designate one ally as 'crown jewel'—that ally takes 40% less damage but Riskmaster takes 20% more

abilities.name: Residual Risk Acceptance
abilities.description: Accepts calculated risk for strategic advantage
abilities.effect: Can choose to take 20% more damage from one attack type to gain immunity to another

creatures.flavorText: Riskmaster knows that perfect security is impossible—but optimal security allocation is not. It sees the battlefield as a risk register, every action a trade-off to be optimized.

creatures.name: Industroyer
creatures.description: A terrifying digital entity that speaks the language of industrial protocols—all of them. Industroyer was first witnessed during the Ukraine power grid attacks, emerging from compromised systems to directly manipulate electrical infrastructure. It doesn't just hack computers; it commands the physical world.

abilities.name: Protocol Weaponization
abilities.description: Turns the target's own communication protocols against them
abilities.effect: Deals additional damage equal to 20% of target's special attack stat

abilities.name: IEC 104 Assault
abilities.description: Sends malicious commands using legitimate industrial protocols
abilities.effect: Bypasses 50% of target's defense when using special attacks

abilities.name: Blackout
abilities.description: Coordinate attack that disables multiple systems simultaneously
abilities.effect: Area attack hitting all opponents; affected targets have -25% accuracy for 3 turns

abilities.name: Crash Override
abilities.description: The ultimate grid destabilization attack
abilities.effect: Massive damage attack that also removes all positive buffs from target

creatures.flavorText: The manifestation of nation-state power projection in cyberspace, Industroyer represents what happens when attackers truly understand industrial systems. Some say it still lurks in compromised networks, waiting.
creatures.captureCondition: Only appears after completing Module 8 with 90%+ accuracy on all questions

creatures.name: Tritanium
creatures.description: Born from the TRITON/TRISIS malware that targeted safety instrumented systems, Tritanium represents the most dangerous class of ICS threat: attacks designed to disable safety protections and enable catastrophic physical damage. Its very existence challenges the assumption that safety systems are inviolable.

abilities.name: Safety System Compromise
abilities.description: Targets and disables protective mechanisms
abilities.effect: Removes all damage-reduction buffs from target; target cannot apply new defense buffs for 2 turns

abilities.name: Framework Injection
abilities.description: Injects malicious code into the target's core programming
abilities.effect: Deals continuous damage over 4 turns that cannot be healed

abilities.name: Living Off the Land
abilities.description: Uses legitimate system tools to avoid detection
abilities.effect: Attacks have 40% chance to be 'invisible'—target doesn't know damage source

abilities.name: SIS Override
abilities.description: The safety systems that should protect... now do nothing
abilities.effect: For 3 turns, target's defensive abilities have no effect

creatures.flavorText: When Tritanium first appeared, security researchers couldn't believe what they were seeing—malware designed not just to disrupt, but to enable destruction by removing the last line of defense.
creatures.captureCondition: Only appears after answering 5 consecutive questions about safety systems correctly

creatures.name: Layerion
creatures.description: The embodiment of defense-in-depth, Layerion exists simultaneously across multiple security layers—physical, network, host, application, data, and procedural. Attacking one manifestation doesn't affect the others. To defeat Layerion, you must overcome every layer independently.

abilities.name: Layered Defense
abilities.description: Maintains six independent defensive layers
abilities.effect: Has 6 'layer shields'—each absorbs up to 30 damage before breaking. When all shields are down, takes normal damage.

abilities.name: Independent Failure
abilities.description: Each defensive layer operates independently
abilities.effect: Attacks that 'bypass defense' only bypass one layer at a time

abilities.name: Defense Coordination
abilities.description: All layers work together for detection and response
abilities.effect: When any layer takes damage, all other layers gain 10% damage boost for their counterattack

abilities.name: Comprehensive Protection
abilities.description: The ultimate defensive stance
abilities.effect: Full heal while restoring all layer shields; can only be used once per battle

creatures.flavorText: Security architects dream of becoming Layerion—a perfect implementation of defense-in-depth where no single failure compromises the whole. Few achieve this level of integration.
creatures.captureCondition: Complete Elite 4 with no single incorrect answer in defense-in-depth questions

creatures.name: Zerodawn
creatures.description: The manifestation of the unknown unknown—the zero-day vulnerability that no one has discovered yet. Zerodawn doesn't exploit known weaknesses; it finds new ones. Its form is constantly shifting because it represents threats that don't yet have names or signatures.

abilities.name: Zero-Day Strike
abilities.description: Exploits an unknown vulnerability
abilities.effect: First attack each battle bypasses all defenses completely

abilities.name: Signature Evasion
abilities.description: Cannot be identified by known patterns
abilities.effect: Immune to attacks that 'detect' or 'identify'—must be attacked directly

abilities.name: Living Off the Land
abilities.description: Uses legitimate tools to accomplish malicious goals
abilities.effect: Attacks appear as normal actions; opponents cannot distinguish attacks from other actions for 2 turns

abilities.name: Emergence
abilities.description: Reveals a previously unknown capability
abilities.effect: Once per battle, copy one of opponent's abilities and use it immediately

creatures.flavorText: Defenders fear Zerodawn above all others because you cannot defend against what you don't know exists. The only hope is behavioral detection—noticing that something is wrong even without understanding what.
creatures.captureCondition: Randomly appears once after achieving 100% on any module; 10% encounter rate

creatures.name: Resilix
creatures.description: A phoenix-like creature composed of backup data, redundant systems, and recovery procedures. When Resilix is knocked down, it doesn't stay down. It rises from verified backups, ready to continue. Attackers learn that destroying Resilix once accomplishes nothing.

abilities.name: Verified Backup
abilities.description: Maintains a known-good state that can be restored
abilities.effect: Once per battle, when HP reaches 0, restore to 50% HP instead of fainting

abilities.name: Redundant Systems
abilities.description: Critical functions continue even when components fail
abilities.effect: When below 30% HP, abilities still function at full effectiveness

abilities.name: Recovery Procedure
abilities.description: Execute practiced recovery steps
abilities.effect: Heal 25% HP and remove one negative status effect

creatures.flavorText: Resilix teaches the most important lesson in ICS security: you cannot prevent all attacks, so you must be able to recover from them. The goal is resilience, not invincibility.

Architecture.description: Architecture types represent network design and segmentation concepts

Protocol.description: Protocol types represent industrial communication standards

Integrity.description: Integrity types represent cryptographic and verification concepts

Monitoring.description: Monitoring types represent detection and logging capabilities

Governance.description: Governance types represent policy, compliance, and risk management

Threat.description: Threat types represent real-world malware and attack patterns

Defense.description: Defense types represent comprehensive security postures

Recovery.description: Recovery types represent backup, redundancy, and resilience

legendaryRules.description: Legendary creatures have special capture and usage rules
legendaryRules.captureRequirements: Each legendary has a unique capture condition based on mastery
legendaryRules.battleLimits: Only one legendary creature can be in active battle team
legendaryRules.eliteFourBonus: Legendary creatures gain +10% to all stats when facing Elite Four

evolutionSystem.description: Some creatures can evolve into more powerful forms
evolutionSystem.statBoosts: Evolution increases all base stats by 15-25%
evolutionSystem.conditions: Each evolution has specific requirements tied to gameplay

synergyBonuses.description: Certain creature combinations provide team bonuses

examples.bonus: Network Fortress: +15% defense for entire team
Total Awareness: Cannot be surprised by hidden effects
Governance Excellence: +20% resistance to status effects
